Improve deploy check when app repeatedly crashes
The ip address changes each time the app restarts,  which caused problems. To improve it:
- The ip address is retrieved right before it is used
- If there is no ip address, it skips the curl command
- Add a 10 second timeout to the curl command. If the ip address is no longer used by docker, it will instead try to load the page from a remote server with the ip address, which can take a while.
- If the app is restarting during 10 checks, it will revert the app without waiting the full time

Fix hiding error when checking if image exists
When deciding how to roll back, it first checks if an old image exists from prepare bundle. If it doesn't, docker prints an error about it not existing and it tries the next method of rolling back. It was easy to think that the docker error was the cause of the deployment failing.
Fix setting client upload limit for reverse proxy

Validate config examples in docs
The examples are validated using `mup validate`.  Any code blocks with the langauge set to `ts` are skipped.

A few examples have been changed to valid javascript, which mostly involves adding `module.exports = <config>` and changing `...` to a comment. Those examples are now also linted since their langague was changed to `js` from `ts`.

Add `imagePort` to support Docker images not `EXPOSE`-ing port 80 (#383)

* Change mup.js.sample to use newer `docker` object-notation.

* Add `imagePort` to support Docker images not `EXPOSE`-ing port 80

Since newer Meteor Docker images are using non-root users to run the app (a commonly suggested security move in Node+Docker environments), it is no longer safe to assume that the Docker image will be exposing (nor may it be possible to EXPOSE) port 80.

This adds an `imagePort` setting in the Docker object (alongside the `image` setting) which defaults to `80` for compatibility with `kadirahq/meteord` (and `meteorhacks/meteord`) but adds the ability to change the *internal* port which is exposed by the docker image (i.e. the port that `--publish PORT:` will map to).

Merge pull request #1 from goooseman/patch-1

[FIX] Check for sslConfig

[FIX] Check for sslConfig

Previously, if there was no ssl section in deploy.js it was throwing an error:
```
[xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx] - Pushing the Startup Script
TypeError ejs:34
    32|   <% for(var volume in volumes) { %>-v <%= volume %>:<%= volumes[volume] %> <% } %>\
    33|   <% for(var args in docker.args) { %> <%= docker.args[args] %> <% } %>\
 >> 34|   <% if(typeof sslConfig.autogenerate === "object")  { %> \
    35|     -e "VIRTUAL_HOST=$HOSTNAME" \
    36|     -e "LETSENCRYPT_HOST=<%= sslConfig.autogenerate.domains %>" \
    37|     -e "LETSENCRYPT_EMAIL=<%= sslConfig.autogenerate.email %>" \

Cannot read property 'autogenerate' of undefined
```

I have added a check for sslConfig, so now it works even when there is no ssl section in deploy.js
